column4: Whenever I boot, my X server complains that the nvidia kernel module isn't the same version as the X server module.  If I do a manual install of the nvidia drivers downloaded from nvidia.com it works until I reboot.  Anyone know what packages I need to re-install to get all the version numbers synced up so I don't have to re-install the drivers every time I boot? =P
dpkg -l |grep nividia

and it doesn't look like there's a newer version of nvidia-kernel-common (the one with the odd version).
use the 97.55 driver
apt-cache search nvidia

what version is your kernel module?
